intro: Diphasiastrum thyoides, commonly known as the eastern prickly pear, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its spiny, succulent stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, three-lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
